metadata.description: Smart rule-based credit insight engine with compound scoring and context-aware logic

rules.label: üî¥ Critical Utilization
rules.template: Your {{Facility}} with {{Lender_Type}} is at {{creditutilizationratio}}% utilization (RM {{balance}} of RM {{limit}}), indicating the account is maxed out.
rules.recommendation: URGENT: Maxed out credit severely damages your score and signals financial distress. Stop using this card immediately and pay down at least RM {{(balance - limit * 0.8)|round(2)}} to bring it below 80%.

rules.label: üî¥ High Utilization
rules.condition: creditutilizationratio >= 80 and creditutilizationratio < 95 and is_revolving == true
rules.template: Your {{Facility}} with {{Lender_Type}} shows {{creditutilizationratio}}% utilization (RM {{balance}} of RM {{limit}}), which is above the critical 80% threshold.
rules.recommendation: High utilization above 80% can reduce your CTOS score by 50-100 points. Aim to pay down at least RM {{(balance - limit * 0.3)|round(2)}} to reach the ideal 30% threshold.

rules.label: üü† Moderate Utilization
rules.condition: creditutilizationratio >= 50 and creditutilizationratio < 80 and is_revolving == true
rules.template: Your {{Facility}} with {{Lender_Type}} shows {{creditutilizationratio}}% utilization, which is above ideal levels.
rules.recommendation: While not critical, utilization above 50% can impact your score. Try to keep balances below 30% by paying down approximately RM {{(balance - limit * 0.3)|round(2)}}.

rules.label: ‚ö†Ô∏è High Utilization + Late Payments
rules.condition: creditutilizationratio >= 70 and payment_conduct_code >= 1 and is_revolving == true
rules.template: Your {{Facility}} with {{Lender_Type}} shows concerning pattern: {{creditutilizationratio}}% utilization combined with payment delays (code {{payment_conduct_code}}). This compounds credit risk.
rules.recommendation: PRIORITY ACTION: The combination of high utilization and missed payments creates a downward spiral. Focus on bringing this account current first, then reducing balance below 50%.

rules.label: üü† Serious Delinquency
rules.template: Your {{Facility}} with {{Lender_Type}} has serious delinquency (code {{payment_conduct_code}}), indicating 120+ days overdue.
rules.recommendation: CRITICAL: Accounts 120+ days overdue may be referred for legal action. Contact {{Lender_Type}} immediately to negotiate restructuring or settlement. This severely damages credit for up to 2 years.

rules.label: üü† Missed Payments
rules.template: Your {{Facility}} with {{Lender_Type}} has delinquency (code {{payment_conduct_code}}), indicating 60-120 days overdue.
rules.recommendation: Accounts 60+ days overdue severely damage your credit. Reach out to your lender immediately to negotiate a payment plan or restructuring before it escalates further.

rules.label: üü† Missed Payments
rules.template: Your {{Facility}} with {{Lender_Type}} shows recent payment issues (code {{payment_conduct_code}}) in the last 12 months.
rules.recommendation: Payment codes 1-2 indicate missed or late payments. Contact your lender immediately to bring the account current. Set up auto-debit to prevent future delays.

rules.label: ‚ö†Ô∏è Worsening Payment Pattern
rules.template: Your {{Facility}} with {{Lender_Type}} shows payment issues despite having {{oldest_account_years|round(1)}} years of credit history.
rules.recommendation: Payment problems on established accounts suggest changing financial circumstances. Review your budget urgently and consider credit counseling if you're experiencing financial hardship.

rules.label: üü° Excessive Applications
rules.template: You've applied for {{numapplicationslast12months}} credit facilities in the past year, which is significantly above average.
rules.recommendation: Excessive applications (5+) suggest credit desperation to lenders and can lower your score by 20-50 points. Wait at least 6 months before new applications and use pre-qualification tools to avoid hard inquiries.

rules.label: üü° Frequent Applications
rules.template: You've applied for {{numapplicationslast12months}} credit facilities in the past year.
rules.recommendation: Each application triggers a hard inquiry, temporarily lowering your score. Space out applications (3-6 months apart) and use pre-qualification tools when available.

rules.label: üü° Pending Applications
rules.template: You have {{numpendingapplications}} credit applications still pending.
rules.recommendation: Multiple pending applications suggest credit shopping or desperation. Wait for current applications to complete before submitting new ones.

rules.label: ‚ö†Ô∏è Applications + High Utilization
rules.template: You've applied for {{numapplicationslast12months}} loans while maintaining {{creditutilizationratio}}% average utilization. This pattern suggests potential credit stress.
rules.recommendation: IMPORTANT: Seeking new credit while maxing existing credit raises red flags. Focus on paying down current balances before applying for new credit. Consider debt consolidation if struggling.

rules.label: üü£ Thin Credit File
rules.template: Your credit file shows only {{distinct_account_types}} type of account.
rules.recommendation: A diverse credit mix (cards, loans, mortgages) demonstrates responsible credit management. Consider adding different account types gradually over 6-12 months.

rules.label: üü£ Thin Credit File
rules.template: Your credit file has no credit card history despite having {{oldest_account_months}} months of credit experience.
rules.recommendation: Credit cards, when used responsibly (below 30% utilization), help build credit history. Consider a secured card if you're building credit.

rules.label: üü£ Thin Credit File
rules.template: Your credit file lacks installment loan history (auto, personal, housing loans).
rules.recommendation: Adding a small installment loan and repaying it consistently can help diversify your credit mix and strengthen your profile.

rules.label: ‚ö™ Very Short Credit History
rules.template: Your oldest account is only {{oldest_account_months}} months old, indicating a very new credit profile.
rules.recommendation: Credit history length matters. Keep your oldest accounts open and active. Your score will improve naturally as your credit ages over the next 12-24 months.

rules.label: ‚ö™ Short Credit History
rules.template: Your oldest account is {{oldest_account_months}} months old, showing you're building credit history.
rules.recommendation: Credit history length matters. Keep your oldest accounts open and active to build a stronger credit timeline. Avoid closing old accounts.

rules.label: ‚ö´ Legal Risk
rules.template: Active bankruptcy proceedings found: {{case_details}}.
rules.recommendation: CRITICAL: Bankruptcy proceedings are the most severe credit event. Engage legal counsel immediately. This will remain on your report for 7 years and severely restrict credit access.

rules.label: ‚ö´ Legal Risk
rules.template: You have {{legal_cases_active}} active legal case(s): {{case_types}}.
rules.recommendation: URGENT: Active legal cases (summons, civil suits) severely impact creditworthiness. Engage with legal counsel and creditors immediately to settle before judgment. Legal judgments remain on record for 7 years.

rules.label: ‚ö´ Legal Risk
rules.template: You have {{legal_cases_settled}} settled legal case(s) on record.
rules.recommendation: While settled, these cases remain on your report for up to 2 years. Ensure all documentation shows 'CASE FULLY SETTLED' and request updates if paid but not reflected.

rules.label: ‚ö´ Legal Risk
rules.template: You are a director of {{company_name}} which has winding-up proceedings.
rules.recommendation: Being a director of a company in winding-up affects your personal credit. This does not imply personal liability unless you are a guarantor, but address it with legal counsel.

rules.label: ‚ö™ Trade Reference Issues
rules.template: You have RM {{trade_ref_amount_overdue}} overdue with trade references, with amounts in the {{aging_bucket}} aging bucket.
rules.recommendation: URGENT: Trade reference defaults above RM 5,000 can block B2B transactions and business credit. Clear these immediately and request written confirmation of settlement from the creditor.

rules.label: ‚ö™ Trade Reference Issues
rules.template: You have RM {{trade_ref_amount_overdue}} overdue with trade references.
rules.recommendation: Trade reference defaults can block B2B transactions. Clear these immediately and request written confirmation of settlement from the creditor.

rules.label: ‚ö™ Trade Reference Issues
rules.template: {{trade_ref_reminder_count}} reminder letter(s) sent by trade creditors.
rules.recommendation: Reminder letters indicate persistent payment issues. Settle these accounts immediately to prevent escalation to legal action.

rules.label: üîµ High Lender Concentration
rules.template: You have {{accounts_per_lender}} accounts with {{lender_name}}.
rules.recommendation: Concentration with one lender increases risk if that relationship sours. Consider diversifying across multiple institutions for better credit resilience.

rules.label: üîµ Secured Debt Heavy
rules.template: {{secured_loan_ratio}}% of your debt is secured (property/vehicle collateral).
rules.recommendation: Heavy reliance on secured debt may limit future borrowing capacity. Balance with unsecured credit to show diverse credit management.

rules.label: üîµ High Loan Count
rules.template: You have {{numberofloans}} active credit accounts.
rules.recommendation: While having multiple accounts can show credit experience, too many accounts (6+) can complicate debt management. Consider consolidating if monthly payments are becoming difficult to track.

rules.label: üü¢ Positive Pattern
rules.template: Your {{Facility}} with {{Lender_Type}} shows excellent payment history with no missed payments in the last 12 months.
rules.recommendation: Outstanding! Consistent on-time payments are the foundation of good credit. Continue this pattern to maintain and improve your score.

rules.label: üü¢ Low Utilization
rules.condition: creditutilizationratio < 30 and creditutilizationratio > 0 and is_revolving == true
rules.template: Your {{Facility}} with {{Lender_Type}} utilization of {{creditutilizationratio}}% is within the ideal range.
rules.recommendation: Excellent! Keeping utilization below 30% is a credit best practice and positively impacts your score. This shows responsible credit management.

rules.label: üü¢ Optimal Utilization
rules.condition: creditutilizationratio < 10 and creditutilizationratio > 0 and is_revolving == true
rules.template: Your {{Facility}} with {{Lender_Type}} utilization of {{creditutilizationratio}}% is excellent (under 10%).
rules.recommendation: Exceptional! Utilization under 10% demonstrates strong financial discipline and maximizes your credit score potential.

rules.label: üü¢ Long Credit History
rules.template: Your credit history spans {{oldest_account_years|round(1)}} years, showing established credit experience.
rules.recommendation: A long credit history demonstrates stability and experience managing credit. This is a strong positive factor for lenders.

rules.label: üü¢ Very Long Credit History
rules.template: Your credit history spans {{oldest_account_years|round(1)}} years, showing extensive credit experience.
rules.recommendation: Exceptional! A credit history of 10+ years is highly valued by lenders and significantly strengthens your credit profile.

rules.label: üü¢ Low Application Rate
rules.template: You've made {{numapplicationslast12months}} application(s) in the past year, showing selective credit use.
rules.recommendation: Applying for credit only when needed demonstrates financial discipline and planning.

rules.label: üü¢ Diverse Credit Mix
rules.condition: distinct_account_types >= 3 and has_credit_card == true and has_installment_loan == true
rules.template: Your credit file shows {{distinct_account_types}} different account types, demonstrating diverse credit management.
rules.recommendation: Excellent! A diverse credit mix (cards, installment loans, etc.) shows lenders you can manage different types of credit responsibly.

rules.label: üü¢ Clean Legal Record
rules.condition: legal_cases_active == 0 and legal_cases_settled == 0 and bankruptcy_active == false
rules.template: Your credit report shows no legal cases or bankruptcy proceedings.
rules.recommendation: Excellent! A clean legal record is a strong positive indicator of creditworthiness.

rules.label: ‚ö†Ô∏è Early Warning
rules.condition: creditutilizationratio >= 40 and creditutilizationratio < 50 and payment_conduct_all_zero == true
rules.template: Your {{Facility}} with {{Lender_Type}} utilization is at {{creditutilizationratio}}%, approaching the 50% threshold despite good payment history.
rules.recommendation: PROACTIVE: While your payments are on time, rising utilization suggests increasing reliance on credit. Pay down balances before they cross 50% to avoid score impact.

rules.label: ‚ö†Ô∏è Early Warning
rules.condition: creditutilizationratio >= 60 and oldest_account_months < 12 and is_revolving == true
rules.template: Your {{Facility}} with {{Lender_Type}} is already at {{creditutilizationratio}}% utilization despite being less than a year old.
rules.recommendation: CAUTION: High utilization on new accounts suggests potential financial stress or poor credit management. New accounts should be kept below 30% utilization for optimal score building.

rules.label: ‚ö†Ô∏è Early Warning
rules.template: You've applied for {{numapplicationslast12months}} new credit accounts in the past year despite having {{oldest_account_years|round(1)}} years of established credit.
rules.recommendation: NOTICE: Increased application activity on established credit profiles may signal changing financial circumstances. Ensure you're not over-extending yourself.

rules.label: ‚ö†Ô∏è Triple Risk Factor
rules.template: CRITICAL PATTERN: Your credit profile shows three concurrent risk factors: high utilization ({{creditutilizationratio}}%), payment delays (code {{payment_conduct_code}}), and {{numapplicationslast12months}} recent applications.
rules.recommendation: URGENT ACTION REQUIRED: This combination of factors creates a high-risk profile. Priority steps: 1) Stop new credit applications immediately, 2) Bring all accounts current, 3) Pay down revolving balances below 50%, 4) Consider credit counseling if needed.

rules.label: ‚ö†Ô∏è Utilization + Legal Risk
rules.template: Your credit profile shows both high utilization ({{creditutilizationratio}}%) and active legal cases ({{case_types}}).
rules.recommendation: CRITICAL: The combination of financial stress and legal action creates severe credit risk. Prioritize settling legal matters while maintaining minimum payments on all accounts. Seek legal and financial counseling immediately.

rules.label: ‚ö†Ô∏è Low CTOS Score
rules.template: Your CTOS score of {{ctos_score}} is in the 'Poor' range (300-499), indicating significant credit challenges.
rules.recommendation: FOCUS AREAS: 1) Bring all accounts current (most important), 2) Reduce utilization below 50%, 3) Avoid new applications for 6 months, 4) Check for errors on your report. Improvement typically takes 6-12 months with consistent effort.

rules.label: ‚ÑπÔ∏è Fair CTOS Score
rules.template: Your CTOS score of {{ctos_score}} is in the 'Fair' range (500-649), suggesting room for improvement.
rules.recommendation: IMPROVEMENT PLAN: Focus on keeping utilization below 30%, making all payments on time, and avoiding new applications for 3-6 months. Your score can reach 'Good' (650+) within 6 months with consistent effort.

rules.label: üü¢ Good CTOS Score
rules.template: Your CTOS score of {{ctos_score}} is in the 'Good' range (650-749), indicating solid creditworthiness.
rules.recommendation: Well done! To reach 'Excellent' (750+), focus on maintaining utilization below 10%, keeping all accounts current, and building credit age. Continue your responsible credit management.

rules.label: üü¢ Excellent CTOS Score
rules.template: Your CTOS score of {{ctos_score}} is in the 'Excellent' range (750-850), placing you in the top tier of creditworthiness.
rules.recommendation: Outstanding! Your credit profile is excellent. Maintain your current practices: on-time payments, low utilization, and selective credit use. You qualify for the best rates and terms.
